casebody.data:
Paddock against Beebee.(a)

(a) S. C., C. C. 135.

(b) Grah. Prac. 2d ed. 711, et seq.

An affidavit of service on a clerk of the attorney, must state that the clerk was, at the time, in the office of the attorney.

A uuestion arose as to the regularity of a service of a notice, which appeared from the affidavit to have been made on the clerk of the attorney; the court decided, that as it did not also appear, that the notice was served on the clerk, while he was in the office, it was therefore insufficient.(b)
